definitions.definition: To change (or to be changed) from a solid state to a liquid state, usually by a gradual heat.
examples: I melted butter to make a cake.
When the weather is warm, the snowman will disappear; he will melt .

definitions.definition: To soften , as by a warming or kindly influence; to relax; to render gentle or susceptible to mild influences; sometimes, in a bad sense, to take away the firmness of; to weaken.
To be emotionally softened or touched .
examples: She melted when she saw the romantic message in the Valentine's Day card.
My heart melted when I first heard the song.

definitions.definition: To be very hot and sweat profusely .

main_definition: ( ergative ) To change (or to be changed) from a solid state to a liquid state, usually by a gradual heat.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , figuratively ) To dissolve , disperse , vanish .

( intransitive , figurative ) To be emotionally softened or touched .
( intransitive , colloquial ) To be very hot and sweat profusely .
